intro: Stenogyne macrantha var. gracilis, commonly known as the slender-flowered honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, fragrant flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy surface. The variety gracilis is distinguished by its smaller, more delicate flowers compared to the typical form of Stenogyne macrantha.
